definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: He also became embroiled in controversy surrounding the government bail-out of Chrysler.
sentences.chinese: 同时他也因政府保释克莱斯勒而被卷入巨大争议。

sentences.english: It is shown that the potential copper resource in the East Tianshan Mountains is abundant.
sentences.chinese: 预测认为，东天山地区铜的资源潜力巨大。

sentences.english: This is huge for a pterosaur.
sentences.chinese: 这对翼龙来说非常巨大。

sentences.english: I say that because it gives tremendous liquidity to the markets.
sentences.chinese: 我这样说是因为它给市场带来的巨大的流动性。

sentences.english: Big opportunities seen in small cities.
sentences.chinese: 中国小城市家电市场潜能巨大。

sentences.english: But the weak states remain vulnerable to a loss of confidence by depositors.
sentences.chinese: 一旦储户信心丧失，弱国仍将面临巨大风险。

sentences.english: Objective To review the experience of diagnosis and surgical treatment for giant tumor of mediastinum.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨巨大纵隔肿瘤的诊断和外科治疗经验。

sentences.english: 's point-guard corps. Tim Duncan's inside-outside game effectively puts Bynum on the bench.
sentences.chinese: 邓肯在比赛中的巨大效用会把安猪牢牢地按在板凳上。

sentences.english: And then there is China, which has the greatest potential to undermine the Asia-Pacific peace.
sentences.chinese: 还有就是中国，他是本地区巨大的潜在力量。

sentences.english: the blossom covered the chestnut trees like great wax candles.
sentences.chinese: 满被花朵的栗子树像是巨大的蜡烛。

sentences.english: The death of the boy caused great sadness to the mother.
sentences.chinese: 那男还孩的死给他母亲带来了巨大的伤痛。

sentences.english: The huge surface area of activated charcoal gives it countless bonding sites.
sentences.chinese: 活性炭巨大的表面积提供了大量的活性位点。

sentences.english: The rich lode of Web data, experts warn, has its perils.
sentences.chinese: 专家警告称，网络数据数量巨大也有其弊端。

sentences.english: Maternal diabetes increases the risk of fetal macrosomia and shoulder dystocia.
sentences.chinese: 糖尿病孕妇生育巨大胎儿及发生肩难产的危险性增加。

sentences.english: An enormous heaviness was coming over me.
sentences.chinese: 我突然感到有种巨大的沉重感压迫着我。

sentences.english: To learn is a great virtue, but to be content with what one knows is stupid.
sentences.chinese: 学习是一个巨大的美德，但满足于所知的就是愚蠢了。

definition: how old?/how big?/how much?/so big/that much
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
variant of 衝擊|冲击[chong1 ji1]
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
clearly and easy to see (idiom); obviously/clearly/it goes without saying
